news_header: Maria-Leena Talvitie, the newly appointed Minister for Science and Culture, indicates that national art facilities in Finland may face cultural cuts in the future. The government will discuss funding and cultural policies in the coming months, emphasizing the importance of private donations and the freedom of science.
news_original_title: Uusi tiede- ja kulttuuriministeri: En lähde lupaamaan, että kansalliset taidelaitokset säästyisivät leikkauksilta
news_text: Maria-Leena Talvitie, who will be appointed as Minister for Science and Culture, does not guarantee that national art facilities like the National Theatre and Ateneum will remain unaffected by government cultural cuts. Decisions regarding funding will be made in spring and autumn, with discussions on cultural savings outlined in the government program. Talvitie emphasizes the significance of private donations in supporting Finnish culture and assures that freedom of science is a priority, as guaranteed by the Constitution. The upcoming cultural policy report aims to foster discussions about Finnish culture and its identity.
